artist: Designer: Larsen Design Studio, New York; Producer: Jack Lenor Larsen, Inc.
description: Machine printed black twill cotton and silk weave with a geometrizied floral pattern on a broad vertically striped background Machine printed black twill cotton and silk weave with a geometrizied floral pattern (green, red, grey, beige) on a broad vertically striped pale yellow and pale pink background azalea
image_copyright: © Jack Lenor Larsen%2C Inc.%2C Larsen Design Studio
text: History frequently plays a part in design sensibility. In America, the influence of English gardens and Indian textiles has had a major impact on their respective areas. Jardiniére is reminiscent of shawl fabrics produced in Northern India at the beginning of the 19th century, but the use of a satin striped, print groundcloth references concerns relating to issues of light and shadow that are so important to all areas of design.
title: Jardiniere
